definitions.definition: To stop or pause respecting decision or action; to be in suspense or uncertainty as to a determination .
examples: He hesitated whether to accept the offer or not; men often hesitate in forming a judgment.

definitions.definition: To stammer; to falter in speaking.
To utter with hesitation or to intimate by a reluctant manner.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To stop or pause respecting decision or action; to be in suspense or uncertainty as to a determination .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To stammer; to falter in speaking.
( transitive , poetic , rare ) To utter with hesitation or to intimate by a reluctant manner.
